item.title: PI help running server
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

starbeast199:

so what method of portforward do you suggest me using?

Only one method exists for forwarding a port.

You login to your router, add a rule to your port forwarding / tigger tab, done.

All you need is your ip address, which will be something like 192.168.1.XXX.

EDIT: if you have team viewer I can help you.

Read full topic

item.title: PI help running server

item.title: PI help running server
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

starbeast199:

i do only have one server running i’m useing utorrent for my port

Just portforward correctly, why waste space when you can just add a rule on your router.

Read full topic

item.title: PI help running server
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

You must have another server or application running that is already binding to the port. Check to make sure you only have one server running.

Read full topic
